channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: death toll stands at 6 and national cabinet meets today

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 2.4 million as economic fallout hits oil price, Virgin Australia, nation's death toll stands at 71

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: Record-low oil prices are likely to push down Australia's energy-heavy stock market, as Virgin's administration weighs on sentiment.
item.title: Virgin Airways in administration, oil prices fall below zero

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: Virgin Australia has confirmed it has gone into voluntary administration as WA Health Minister Roger Cook thanks praises the West Australian community after the state recorded its first zero-case day in nearly nine weeks.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Virgin goes into voluntary administration as WA celebrates zero new cases

item.description: Insolvency experts move in, and Victoria confirms 7 new coronavirus cases.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Virgin Australia has confirmed it has gone into voluntary administration, handing the airline over the insolvency experts at Deloitte to restructure the business and find new owners to keep it flying.Â
item.title: Virgin Australia confirms collapse, appoints administrators

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Students will return to school one day a week from May 11 and teachers will be given priority access to coronavirus testing, it has been confirmed, as six new cases of COVID-19 were recorded across NSW.
item.title: Teachers given priority coronavirus testing as NSW school return date confirmed

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: WA Labor is hoping to raise much-needed campaign cash from taxpayer-funded state government political staffers ahead of the 2021 election.
item.title: WA Labor targets taxpayer-funded political staff to raise campaign cash

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: A Ballarat man has been charged with attempted murder after an incident in Wendouree on Monday, in which another man was shot in the face and upper body.
item.title: Charges after man shot in the face in Ballarat

item.description: "An initial swift lick of a scoop while rapidly proceeding away from the ice cream parlour" is allowed to prevent ice cream from dripping, the edict says.
item.title: German region issues rule for eating ice cream during coronavirus

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set to slide as oil prices plunge

item.description: Critics warn against moving too quickly with a medical union secretary saying: "There are serious doubts over existence of long-term immunity to this virus."
item.title: Controversial 'immunity passport' to free recovered Chileans from lockdown

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Thousands of workers, and millions of frequent flyer members will be nervously waiting to see where they stand with administrators.
item.title: 'Terrifying moment': Virgin workers, customers, frequent flyer members face nervous wait for details of collapse

item.description: The former Australian cricketer and coach had three blockages in blood vessels in his heart, which were discovered the day before his 50th birthday.
item.title: 'Am I going to wake up?' Darren Lehmann reveals fears before triple bypass surgery

item.description: The Australian coach has likened Todd Greenberg's exit as NRL chief executive to a coach being sacked when a team performs poorly.
item.title: 'If he is to blame, everyone has to be to blame': Meninga fires up on Greenberg departure

item.description: Oil prices have plunged below zero, the latest never-before-seen number to come out of the economic coma caused by the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Oil price plunges below zero as demand collapses; stocks dip

item.description: Canadian Prime minister Justin Trudeau said on Monday his government would move ahead on the gun control legislation he promised during last year's election campaign after the shooting.Â
item.title: Death toll from Canada's mass shooting rises, Trudeau pledges action on guns

item.description: Stay-at-home orders, which experts say are essential to slow the spread of the virus, have battered the US economy.
item.title: Facebook removes anti-quarantine protest events in some US states

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Students would return to school for one day a week under a plan to gradually resume lessons
item.title: Students to spend one day a week in class under back-to-school plan

item.description: The World Health Organisation chief has revived the alarm just as many countries ease restrictive measures aimed at reducing the spread of the virus.
item.title: WHO chief warns worst of coronavirus pandemic is still ahead

item.description: The deal averts what would have been a fourth consecutive election in just over a year as the country fights its coronavirus outbreak.
item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu reaches power-sharing deal with rival to tackle virus

item.description: The British billionaire said his airlines in Australia and the UK won't survive the pandemic without state support, and that his Virgin Group lacks the resources to help them through.
item.title: Richard Branson says Virgin needs government help in open letter to staff

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: ACTU secretary Sally McManus rejected the idea Australia should have let the coronavirus spread to protect its economy.
item.title: 'How can you say that?': Economist's view of coronavirus lockdown criticised

item.description: Follow our live coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: A Liquified Natural Gas import terminal has been approved to nearly double its planned capacity as shortages loom despite Australia's massive exports.
item.title: Port Kembla gas import terminal set to expand

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: Neither emerges from their handling of the pandemic with any honour.
item.title: Xi and Trump: insecure 'strongmen' who had nothing to offer in a crisis but vanity

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: On Monday the Kings Cross lawyer was found guilty of all six counts including perverting the course of justice, aiding a criminal group and attempting to gain a financial advantage.
item.title: 'Ridiculously dodgy' lawyer Michael Croke found guilty

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: New research has found that 22 per cent of Australian children are "developmentally vulnerable" at age five.
item.title: One in five Australian five-year-olds at risk of falling behind in school

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Confession season is in full swing as three of the big four banks get ready to deliver their half year results, with dividend payments almost certainly off the table.
item.title: Risk or reward: Can banks justify paying dividends?

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: A free recording of the singer-songwriter's stunning 2013 Sydney Opera House performance will be released online this week.
item.title: 'Back to the essence': Sarah Blasko finds comfort in music

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: A little bit country, a little bit rock 'n' roll? With these books, you can be it all.
item.title: Top 5 music books to round out your cultural blindspots

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: A model favoured by the Europeans would better protect privacy.
item.title: It pains me to say this, but when it comes to the virus app Barnaby Joyce has a point

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The Berejiklian government will recall NSW Parliament on May 11 to pass critical rental relief legislation.
item.title: NSW Parliament recalled to debate rental relief measures

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the your day in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, April 21

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Dwayne Kennedy was told he didn't need to come to court for his hearing, so he didn't. He was then arrested for not attending court and remanded in custody.
item.title: Aboriginal man locked up in COVID-19 court bungle

item.dc:creator: Pallavi Singhal
item.description: The suburbs which recorded NSW's first cases of local transmission of COVID-19 have been revealed, as health experts warn that this is the measure Australia needs to watch.
item.title: How local outbreaks of COVID-19 occurred across Sydney

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Numbers of patients visiting hospital emergency departments have dropped to record lows across Australia amid fears people are delaying life-saving treatment.
item.title: Locked-down lives drive emergency department numbers to record lows

item.description: The government needs to reassure a cautious electorate that the coronavirus tracing app will not lead to privacy breaches.
item.title: Tracking app needs privacy guarantees to boost uptake

item.description: The pandemic isn't stopping the meetings at the heart of Alcoholics Anonymous and other 12-step programs - they are just going digital.
item.title: COVID-19 is global but so is recovery from addiction

item.dc:creator: Ursula Dubosarsky
item.description: During lockdown children are doubtless spending plenty of time staring at their devices, but are they reading books on them?
item.title: Children paying the price of library shutdowns

item.dc:creator: Merlin Crossley
item.description: Governments and taxpayers asked universities to generate their own funds - and they did - but now the music has stopped.
item.title: If we want world-class universities we need to find a way to pay for them

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Neobank 86 400 has made an unsuccessful plea to the Reserve Bank for small banks to be granted more favourable access to a $90 billion emergency funding scheme.
item.title: Neobank 86 400 warns RBA scheme driving big four's cheap fixed rates

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: As the world pivots to coronavirus research, biotech companies are being forced to press pause on non-COVID-19 research projects.
item.title: Coronavirus focus tipped to 'mothball' biotech research

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: Mrs Petrov chooses Australia, teeth survey and rush for produce.
item.title: In the Herald: April 21, 1954

item.dc:creator: Thomas Mitchell
item.description: When it comes to setting up a functional home gym, less is more, according to the pros.
item.title: The only four pieces of workout equipment you need at home

item.description: 50 years ago, a West Australian farmer declared his wheat and sheep station at Hutt River an independent principality.
item.title: From the Archives, 1973: The sheep station that seceded

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Massive piece of legislation covering to be rushed through State Parliament on Thursday.
item.title: COVID-19 becomes law; government to give itself sweeping new powers

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Just how did the publishers of Malcolm Turnbull's memoir find out their intellectual property was quickly spreading across the Canberra bubble?
item.title: Hunting the malcontents who shared Malâs contents

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 21, 2020

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: As further details emerged about Cricket Australia's financial position, cricket's states believe the dire warnings from the governing body have been overblown.
item.title: Savage cuts save cricket only $3m as states question cash crisis
